body: I thought a bit about this and I'm quite sure we should do sth about it, but I'm not sure what. Consider a call like `torch.add(x, 1, out=y[0])`. Right now, if `y[0]` has a correct size, it will be filled with `x + 1`, otherwise it will be a temporary tensor that will get resized and will no longer share storage with `y`, so the output will be silently lost...

Right now, if y[0] has a correct size, it will be filled with x + 1, otherwise it will be a temporary tensor that will get resized and will no longer share storage with y, so the output will be silently lost...
